characters.name: Master Ace
intro: PC: Oh wonderful… another inferior creature, here to bother me.
PC: <Sigh>  Well, you’re hardly worth my time…

attacks.name: Troll
dialog: PC posts a particularly unkind comment about you on the internet.  It directly targets your feels.
PC: Oh look, your shame is trending.

attacks.name: Sound Blaster
dialog: PC turns the speakers up to 11. It’s like an earthquake for your ears.

attacks.name: Blast Processing
dialog: PC: Nice video card, newbie.  Here’s a thought for you… G-P-U-SUCK.
It’s not a great joke, but it starts a pun thread online all the same.  You feel embarrassed about each and every reply.

attacks.name: Battering RAM
dialog: PC: This will be one for the memory book!
PC smashes into you with the full weight of a CRT monitor.
You have a feeling you’ll be randomly accessing the memory of this injury for weeks.

conversations.prompt: PC: Sigh, to think I have to waste my precious cycles deleting you...

replies.text: Don’t get out much, do you?
followup: Master Ace glances at his wires, and looks really embarrassed.
PC: Some of us don’t need portability…
PC: ...because we make up for it with raw power!

replies.text: The 90s wants its monitor back
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

replies.text: What a lovely shade of beige!
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

conversations.prompt: PC: Nice cartridges, console peasant.  I could emulate you without breaking a sweat.

replies.text: Watch out, it’s a power outage!
followup: PC: Oh no!  But I won’t be shut down properly!
Master Ace looks around in terror, and then looks really embarrassed.
PC: Hey, that’s not funny...
PC: ...not all of us have batteries, you know...

replies.text: Don’t you have a basement to live in?
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

replies.text: That’s a great cardboard box impression.
followup: PC looks pretty annoyed.

conversations.prompt: PC: Okay, so I might not be portable, but I am a machine of both pleasure and productivity!

replies.text: How are those driver conflicts going?
followup: Master Ace thinks about all the old games and software he can’t run, and then looks really embarrassed.
PC: I’m sure I could get those things working if I just…
PC: ...spend a couple days reinstalling old operating systems...
PC: ...and drivers... and...

replies.text: Hey look, another OS update!
followup: PC looks pretty annoyed.

replies.text: I bet spreadsheets are a blast!
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

conversations.prompt: PC: I will admit you have your place in the world… but you lack versatility!  Adaptability!  Customizability!

replies.text: At least I know who I am.
followup: Master Ace gets kind of quiet, and looks pretty sad.

replies.text: And room for big ugly stickers?
followup: PC looks pretty annoyed.

replies.text: Keyboard and mouse games FTL
followup: PC looks mildly irritated.

replies: Master Ace looks longingly at your camera, and quietly curses his age.
PC: Say, you don’t have PC drivers for that fine camera of yours, do you?
PC: I have attractive people to video chat with, you see... sigh... maybe someday.
Master Ace tries to hide a look of pity... and then very much stops trying to hide it.
PC: You’re trying to impress ME with that tiny screen?
PC: Come back when that thing is 17 inches and 50 pounds, and then we’ll talk...
Master Ace sees the printer and instinctively recoils in horror.
PC: Oh no... a printer... get that thing away from me! Ugh!
PC: I still have nightmares about my last clogged print queue.  <Shudder>
Master Ace scoffs at your receiver, and smiles derisively.
PC: Oh please, you console pleb. I invented the internet.

win: PC: You know... even for all of this power... I do sometimes wonder what my purpose truly is.
PC: Do I play games? ...Write novels? ...Balance checkbooks?
PC: ...or just sit here, day after day, browsing social media...?
PC sighs, and seems wistful over many misspent hours.
PC: ...so many cat videos...
PC: ...you've given me a lot to think about, little friend.
PC: ...also, we're not friends.
PC: I'd like to be alone for a while. Maybe some silent reflection would help.
PC: Tell you what. Why don't you take these speakers? I won't be needing them for a while.
PC: I wish you luck in the battles ahead. You're more powerful than you look.
PC: ...not as powerful as me, of course, console filth. ...but... you'll be fine. Good luck.
lose: PC: Let's face it, you don't stand much of a chance against the PC Master Ace.
PC: Don't bother me again until you have better hardware, console peasant.

characters.name: Tabitha
intro: Tabitha: Oh my, what a pitiful creature.  That form factor... that color... that resolution!
Tabitha: My, but you are an ugly little thing, aren’t you?

attacks.name: Glare
dialog: Tabitha angles herself just right to shine a vicious beam of light into your screen.
Tabitha: What can I say?  Some of us simply shine, my dear.

attacks.name: In-App Purchase
dialog: Tabitha quickly charges your credit card with a series of frivolous microtransactions.  You wonder what a “gem” does.
Tabitha: It's so much easier than playing the game!

attacks.name: Permissions Barrage
dialog: Tabitha overloads your screen with a seemingly endless series of permissions notifications.
Tabitha: Oh, who has time to read all those pesky details? Just hit accept, would you?

attacks.name: On-Screen Controls
dialog: Tabitha shows off her games. You find it hard to push down the frustration you feel at the clunky on-screen controls interfaces.
Tabitha: I swear it feels perfectly intuitive once you get used to it!

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: Let’s get this over with quickly, shall we, darling?  I can’t afford to be seen with you.

replies.text: And you sure do like to be seen...
followup: Tabitha's screen seems to turn a little redder.
Tabitha: Hey, some of us do strive for elegance, you know.
Tabitha: It's not such a bad thing to be fashionable.

replies.text: Can you see with that glare?
followup: Tabitha looks mildly irritated.

replies.text: Are all of your games about candy?
followup: Tabitha looks mildly irritated.

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: I think you're hurting my camera just looking at you...

replies.text: You must be quite the photographer
followup: Tabitha looks really embarrassed, like she's recalling some bad memories.
Tabitha: It's not my fault people hold me up at concerts...
Tabitha: ...so many angry people behind me...

replies.text: Bought any expensive apps lately?
followup: Tabitha looks mildly irritated.

replies.text: Your case doesn't match your frame
followup: Tabitha looks pretty annoyed.

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: I'm tired of associating with common rabble like you.  It's bad for my image.

replies.text: No surprise you double as a mirror
followup: Tabitha's face tightens into an embarrassed scowl.
Tabitha: Is it such a crime to want to look good?
Tabitha: I've traveled with movie stars.  I get worked on by geniuses.

replies.text: Done any good typing lately?
followup: Tabitha looks pretty annoyed.

replies.text: What's that far away sound? Oh, your speakers.
followup: Tabitha looks mildly irritated.

conversations.prompt: Tabitha: Fine, you might be more... functional... but I am a machine of grace and style!

replies.text: And I'm actually good at what I do.
followup: Tabitha's eyes seem far away.  She looks a little sad.

replies.text: Run! It's a bored toddler!
followup: Tabitha looks pretty annoyed.

replies.text: My games have more than one button!
followup: Tabitha looks mildly irritated.

replies: Tabitha looks embarrassed, and glances back at her single tiny rear speaker.
Tabitha: Such rich sound... so... audible...
Tabitha scoffs at your screen.
Tabitha: Pah!  I'm full color, high-res, and gorgeous.
Tabitha: What do you expect to prove with that tiny mess of pixels?
Tabitha looks a bit jealous.
Tabitha: That must be nice... every time I try to print, it's a wireless nightmare...
Tabitha openly laughs.
Tabitha: Please, I was born wireless.

win: Tabitha: You're right, of course...
Tabitha: I've always felt trapped between worlds...
Tabitha: Too big for a pocket... too small for a desktop...
Tabitha: Maybe it's time I did some thinking about who *I* want to be.
Tabitha looks a little embarrassed about something.
Tabitha: And you're right about this camera, of course.  It's ridiculous, as big as I am.
Tabitha: But you... you look like you're going places.  Perhaps you could use it?
Tabitha: I have to say, you might be ugly... but I admire your courage.
Tabitha: Because believe me, it takes courage going out into the world looking like... that...
Tabitha: I wish you luck in the battles ahead, my hideous little friend.
Tabitha: Take some pictures for me, would ya?
lose: Tabitha: Form over function, poor creature.
Tabitha: And do please stay out of my spotlight until you have some better accessories, hm?
